turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: What makes you cry?

turns.speaker: SOPHY
turns.text: If I'm sad, or tired, or sometimes when I'm angry or when somebody's being mean to me.

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Pretty much the same reasons I was crying.  But things will be better when we move to a new place.

turns.speaker: SOPHY
turns.text: Then I'm gonna do what you do to make me feel better when I'm sad.

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Sophy?  Are you okay?

turns.speaker: SOPHY
turns.text: Mommy, where are you?

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Don't worry, I'm coming to get you.

turns.speaker: SOPHY
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: Soon, baby.

turns.speaker: SOPHY
turns.text: Mommy, I'm scared.

turns.speaker: LAUREN
turns.text: There's nothing to be afraid of. Everything's going to be alright.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You're a thief?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Girl's gotta make a living.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Thank God.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: First time I ever heard that.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I was expecting someone else.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Guess it wasn't the pizza delivery guy.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You're lucky.  I almost pulled the trigger.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm sorry if I caught you at a bad time.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: We're just a little tense right now...  It's okay.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You have good taste.  French, 1920's, attributed to Chitarus.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Whoever that is.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: So, what, you liked it because it was shiny?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No, because it's the Egyptian goddess Bast.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Who is...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The goddess who comprehends all goddesses, eye of Ra, protector, avenger, and destroyer, giver of life, who lives forever... I could keep going.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So this guy walks into a bar and says...

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: We didn't get a chance to finish our conversation the other night.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Original Cindy, say hi to my good friend--

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Logan Cale.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sorry about your window.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Can we go somewhere and talk?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Lemme get my coat.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: The one you're wearing?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How'd you find me?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Wasn't that hard.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Am I s'posed to be flattered by all the attention?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Now you know who I am, where I live.  I figured I better find out who I'm dealing with in case you were looking to hurt me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So now you tracked me down.  What d'ya think?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Too early to tell.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How does Mrs. Eyes Only like being married to a guy on everybody's hit list?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Lauren's not my wife.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Girlfriend?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: One of my sources.  Her husband was murdered by Edgar Sonrisa.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's your shot in all this?  Being a famous, anonymous, underground, pirate, cyber-journalist can't be much of a payday.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Fortunately, my needs are met in that department.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So, what, you just like the sound of your own voice?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Look around at all this...  Built by people who got up every morning and worked hard trying to make a better life.  Then the bomb happened and everyone got scared.  They blinked and before they knew it they'd given away the store to a bunch of thugs who were happy to take it off their hands.  Overnight the government, the police, everything intended to protect the people had been turned against them.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You miss the good ol' days.  Even though there were still poor people who died from diseases when they didn't have to. And rich people spent obscene amounts of money redecorating their houses to match the cat.  Those good ol' days?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: People had a choice, even if they took it for granted.  And now they don't.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: So what are you gonna do about it?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Something.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Personally, I'm more interested in going fast on my motorcycle or climbing the Trans American building with my pals. Instead of giving myself a headache over stuff I can't do anything about.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You accept the way things are, you're an active participant in making it worse.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is the social studies class over for today?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Ever notice how cats always seem to turn up around dinner time?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I won't be staying.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'm not a half bad cook.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Like following me around and pestering the people I work with wasn't bad enough, but breaking into my apartment--

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: It was open.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You got a lotta nerve.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Me?  You're the one who tried to rip off this piece.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Completely different situation.  I steal things in order to sell them.  For money. It's called commerce.  But some stranger sneaking into a girl's bedroom is...bent.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Bent?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bent.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You make it sound I pawed through your priceless collection of underwear.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How do I know you didn't?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: So saw my hands off, I left you a present.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Am I s'posed to be grateful?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: That would be appropriate, yes.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How'm I s'posed to ever sleep there again knowing some pervo's probably touched everything I own?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You're that nervous, you're welcome to stay here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Whoa there, Tex!  We've been through all this.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: It's alright, Peter, we're fine.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We are not fine.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Look, if I made you nervous or uncomfortable or creeped you out--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yes on all counts.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'm sorry.  It wasn't my intention.  But I had to see you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You'd think a guy who's taken on the job of saving the world would have a few more important things to do than traipse around after some girl.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I haven't been able to get you off my mind.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You need to get out more.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: C'mere, I want to show you something.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Gold leaf, art nouveau, French, early nineteen hundreds... I could probably fence this for three or four grand.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No, I meant this.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Expensive gifts, surprise late-night visits, over-the-top flattery... You always come on this strong?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Only when I meet someone I have to know everything about.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Suppose I could help you locate the other ones.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The other ones?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: The other one like you...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You lost me.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: C'mon, Max.  First I watch you dive headfirst out the window fifteen stories up like you're Rocky the flying squirrel. Then, I found this in your apartment.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: L-Triptophane...a neurotransmitter sometimes used in homeopathy to control seizures.  Then the lightbulb went off.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You did go through my stuff.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know what kind of game you're playing here but I'm out because you are a whack-job.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: He was working on something called Project Manticore, which was using recombinant DNA to produce a superior human...a warrior...an advanced infantry soldier.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not that I don't enjoy a good urban legend now and then but what does any of this have to do with me?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: The bar code on your neck, Max.  I know who you are and I know who you're running from.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We got separated right away.  I never knew how many made it.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: How well do you remember the lab?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I remember fine.  I just didn't understand what was going on.  They never told us anything except what to do.  It took me a long time afterwards to figure things out.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: How much do you know?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I know they made me.  Even got the label on my neck to prove it.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: The technical term for you is "chimera"...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah...a made-up creature.  Like in mythology...with the head of a lion, the body of a goat and the tail of...

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: A girl.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Your basic hodge-podge.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Hardly...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Christmas is a snap when you got no parents or relatives, just a bunch of gene sequences from probably twenty different people.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Like extra virgin olive oil, the best of the best.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You said you could help.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I need to find this technician, or anyone else who knows about Project Manticore. They would've used surrogate mothers to carry you after the in-vitro work... If I can track down one of them.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's in it for you?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Your help.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I already don't like the sound of this.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: The woman you met, Lauren.  She supervised workers removing cortodiazapine from gel caps by hand and replacing it with powdered sugar.  The real drug was shipped out of the country. The placebos were distributed to County VA Hospital and six veterans' clinics in the area.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's low, but this effects me how exactly?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: She's prepared to testify that she was instructed to do this by one of Edgar Sonrisa's managers.  You know who Sonrisa is?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, I catch your hacks.  He's Satan's lap dog, or something.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: So, you know the lengths he'll go to keep her from going public... I'm turning Lauren over to Canadian law enforcement tomorrow.  They'll put her in witness protection, but if you're with her the risk of her safety goes way down.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I didn't make it this far by attracting a lot of attention.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: She's put her life on the line, and her faith in me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They want me...bad.  Or at least they don't want me grabbed up by the Chinese or whoever.  Best case, I wind up back in that facility.  More likely, it's a long drive out in the country, if you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They've lost track of me and I plan to keep it that way.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You're a soldier, Max.  That's what you were put here for.  But soldiers need a mission otherwise they tear themselves up.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's deep.  But before you lecture me about the meaning of life maybe you oughta get one...ta ta.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: See you're back and still rocking the boat.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Somebody's got to.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I would've come sooner, but...I didn't... How're you doin'?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Not in any pain...the good and bad news of a blown out spinal cord.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: My mother used to say the universe is right on schedule.  Everything happens like it's supposed to.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You believe that?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I've never been much for trying to understand why bad things happen, I just know they do.  So the job's to figure out how to deal with the consequences.  Which you did... You took that sonuvabitch out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, not me personally.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: On accounta you, Sonrisa didn't get to buy off the jury, or kill the judge. He's gone.  Once and for all.  It was war, Max, and you won.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's what soldiers do, right?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Open it.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: It turned up on the black market.  One of my sources thought I might be interested.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Deeds, not words.  I need your help.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Forty-seven people drowned last night off the coast of Vancouver after paying smugglers twenty thousand apiece to get into Canada so they could get work in order to eat.  Only they got marched overboard at gunpoint instead.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Look, thank you for this but--

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: These girls, kidnapped during the last month and sold overseas to the highest bidder.  The oldest is twelve.  The youngest about the same age you were when you escaped.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And I feel real bad about all that but it doesn't mean I need to get involved.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: You are involved.  By being alive you're involved.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: We're quoting Mom again.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Maybe we got screwed outta living in a time when we could sit in a cafe, sipping our lattes wearing two thousand dollar wrist watches while we plan our next vacation.  But the world got a whole lot meaner all of a sudden.  Wasn't s'posed to, but it did.  And it's back to the law of the jungle.  You got your predators and you got your victims.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And you still think you can do something to change that.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: With your help.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Civilization as we know it is unraveling before our eyes.  But Logan and Max, with a song in their hearts are gonna march into battle to keep that from happening.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: And whether you want to believe it or not, you already fired the first shot.  On another matter, Federal Corrections used to keep records on distinguishing marks-- scars, tattoos.  I did a search and came up with this.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: That was taken nine years ago... I.D.'d as Michael Hanover.  Sentenced to 18 months in the state penn at Rawlins, Wyoming for armed robbery.  He escaped from custody after 4 days.  Hasn't been seen or heard from since.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Zack... He made it... He's alive...

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'm looking for a lady who works here.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: Ladies would be elsewhere.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Know where I can find her?

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: You don't want to.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: But she does work here?

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: She may be easy on the eyes but she's trouble, trust me.  Hot run to two-oh-two Sansomme.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I need to talk to her.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: Can't help you.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: Max something.  I got no clue where she stays.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Any idea when she'll be back?

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I'll wait.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: A friend of your fiance's.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: To set the record straight about where he was the other night when he said he was working late.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: My name's Lydia.  And it seems you and I have a lot in common.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You said you knew where my fiance was the other night.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: With me, where he's been after work, three, sometimes four nights a week for the last two months... We have what you might call an intimate relationship.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How do I know you're telling the truth?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: He been sleeping in a T-shirt lately?  That's so you won't see the fingernail marks on his back.  Bet you didn't know your boyfriend finds a little pain exciting.  He didn't either...at first.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Look, I don't know what you want--

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I thought it was important for you to know the facts.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And so should you.  Sketchy told me I could expect a visit from you.  I know all about how you threatened him.  That if he didn't break it off with me, you'd save him the trouble.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Well, it's over between you and him. We're getting married next month.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: How sweet.  Standing by your man, even after what he did.  You're a very understanding person.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Big part of loving someone's being able to forgive them.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You're also a fool.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I think you should go now.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Not before we get something straight you prissy little bitch.  I decide when I'm done with your boyfriend.  Not him, and certainly not you.  Unless maybe you want to find out just how sharp these nails really are.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: This is not a place you wanna go.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Let go of my hand.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Help... Lemme go... No, don't let me go... Help...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Now, here's how it's gonna be, Lydia. You're gonna take your threats and your acrylic nails, and you're gonna go home and figure out your marriage, instead of trying to make other people feel as miserable as you do, understand?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Say the words, "I understand."

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And if I ever catch you coming near my man again...

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I asked you to keep that thing outside.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You did.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: You drive away business roarin' in like that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, does kinda break the elegant atmosphere you got goin' on here.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: You got a punk-ass mouth on you, kid.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: My name's not kid.  It's client.  As in the person who pays for your opulent lifestyle.  Now, you got something for me or not?

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Right here someplace.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I got a hit on the car.  An oh-five Tahoe, blue, with Wyoming tags... AGT349... It wasn't easy 'cause you were off in one of the numbers.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Sorry, I was seven at the time.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who's this guy?  This isn't who we're looking for...her name was Hannah.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: He got the car in a trade for his old pick-up and some food...no bill of sale or nothing.  It was right after the pulse so all the DMV records were wiped.  So we don't get anything on the seller.  Except I actually managed to find this guy, six hours on the phone... Say thank you.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: He says he got it from a woman.  Doesn't remember her name but she fits the description you gave like a glove.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Guy says he made the trade in Gillette, Wyoming sometime in the fall of oh-nine.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Then what?

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Then what?  That's it.  That's all I got.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Nothing on Hannah?

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: A nuclear airburst wipes out every record of every kind in every computer east of the Rockies, and you want me to find some woman you met when you were seven, whose last name you don't even know... Maybe if you could give me something more on her...anything you can remember, some detail...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She was a nurse.  She must've lived near there, somewhere, near the...  ...the clinic.  There must be some registry of nurses or medical technicians or whatever for Wyoming.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Only a last name would be nice.  Or the nearest town to this...clinic.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What about the other kids?  You get anything on them?

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: They don't exactly have a search engine for finding a bunch of kids with bar- codes on their necks, which is something I'm not even going to ask about--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You were gonna run through the law enforcement databases for a match on identifying marks.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Nothing so far from arrests, hospital admissions or coroners.  This kind of search...it's heavy spadework.  I'm gonna need--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: More money... Like I'm shocked to hear you say that.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: As long as you're okay.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I'll live... Regarding your case...I'm afraid I've come up with some bad news on your fiance.  Lemme get the file.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I don't know what your story is and I don't want to.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Here's your money.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Whoever tossed this place wants you.  And I'm looking to stay outta the line of fire.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How's this about me?

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: They lifted my wallet to make it look like a robbery.  But there's a bug in my computer keyboard, a tap on the phone and a mike in the light fixture.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Like you said, maybe somebody's tracking one of your investigations.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Hardware's too sophisticated.  It's gotta be the government.  And why do I think they're looking for you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I'm you, I take that money and get outta town while you can.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Your fiance has four previous wives.  His M.O. is to clean 'em out and take off.  Which is what you oughta do.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Bastard...

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: I'm sorry I couldn't come up with something more positive.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You and me both.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I need a favor... I need you to trace a number for me.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Sure you wanna be havin' this conversation over the phone?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Just do it... Five-seven-five-oh- eight...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Zero... C'mon, Dan I don't have all day.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: Got a pencil?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Just give it to me.  I'll remember.

turns.speaker: VOGELSANG
turns.text: One-seven-four-nine-five Natoma.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm on my way.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Morning, Sunshine...

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Caught some son-of-a-bitch stealing my bike.  Used a car jack to blow out my U lock and bent a bunch of spokes.  So now I gotta get my wheels fixed.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: At least he didn't swing with your ride.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: No, but I broke a nail giving him a cranium crack and that just sort of wrecks your day, know what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Now, why can't I find a girlfriend like that?  Brings him lunch everyday, thoughtful, sweet, legs from here to there--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Straight.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Shame, wastin' a girl like that on a guy, but what're you gonna do?

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Craps all over everything and everyone and then wants mommy to forgive him.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What guys do.  'Nother order.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: You're way more philosophical than I could ever be.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I just don't go in with any expectations.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's odd...

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Tell me the truth.  Am I a female fog bank?

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: You're not seriously buying into Darren's nonsense.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: He was just trying to blame you 'cause he's a slut.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Hell yeah.  There's not the slightest grain of truth in anything that idiot was saying.  You are a totally down-ass female and a straight-up friend who happens to be a little...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A little what?

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: You know what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: If I knew what you were saying, I wouldn't be asking.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: How long you and me known each other?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A long time.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Long enough for you to pretty much read me like a book, right?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Because you're probably my closest friend in the whole world.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: And back at ya.  Only there's a part of you that's... I don't know--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A fog bank.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: More like a mystery... Which isn't bad. It's just kinduv...mysterious...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Gotta go.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's a secret.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: You're actually gonna bail Sketchy out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, 'cause maybe he's learned his lesson.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Unlikely.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And because he's my friend.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Friends don't help other friends cheat.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And because I actually kinda feel sorry for guys sometimes.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They're prisoners to their genes.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: So are dogs.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: They don't have a lot of moving parts.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: Only one I can think of.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Besides, think of the drama I'm sparing Natalie.

turns.speaker: ORIGINAL CINDY
turns.text: I say hang the bastard out to dry, let her see him for the heel he is, then maybe she'll step to the all-girl team and let mama-licious ease her pain.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: But, of course, there's nothing self- serving in that scenario.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah, I can see to it your winning streak continues.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: I'll bet you can.  Sit.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Not right now.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: Not right now?  Okay, when?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Right after you change your wardrobe, your personality and drop about thirty pounds.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: Quite a mouth on a girl so young...  ...but my guess is talking is not what it does best.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Only way you're ever gonna find out is reincarnation... Fact is, you are gonna pay me, and I am gonna provide you with a service.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: I actually know how this works.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You're gonna pay me fifty thousand dollars...

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What, you gonna put me on your Christmas card list?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Look, you're a player... I'm bringing you this on a plate, and my fee is just the normal cost of doing business.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: Pull the cash.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: So, how do you get the woman to come to me?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I told her it's just business to you, that all you want is a reasonable solution to this.  You give her daughter back, she agrees to leave the country.  I play the guarantor, drive her down to Mexico tonight, and put her on a train to Brazil or wherever.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: And she bought that?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I have sincere eyes.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: Make the call.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's gonna need to know that her little girl's alright.

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: She's got my word.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: She's gonna want to hear for herself.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Can you put that in a bag or something?

turns.speaker: SONRISA
turns.text: You get it when I get her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Okay...idea.  Compromise, right?  Bruno here comes with me.  He holds the money until mommy shows up, then we close escrow.  What you do with her after I'm gone doesn't keep me awake nights.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's payday, need me to pick up your check?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're the best, Maxie.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Playing hooky again?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Feel like the dog's dinner.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Probably a touch of what's going around.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I know what I got, Max.  They put me back on that drug they're giving the other vets.  Only the guy does those cable hacks says the stuff's no good.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Don't believe everything you hear on TV.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What if he's on the level?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Here's the dealio on Eyes Only.  He's probably some wack rich dude sitting around in a trick-ass apartment, bored stupid.  So he gets off on scarin' the poop outta folks like you-- I gotta go.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell everybody hey.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You can tell 'em yourself tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Catch you back at the wall.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Later.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Quitting time.  Grab a cold one?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: I gotta meet Natalie for dinner.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Right, the big one-oh.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: But I'll take a rain check...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Hey, Sketchy--

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: We gotta talk.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You blew off your girlfriend last night, even though it was the big one-oh.  I'd be pissed off too if I was her.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Not half as pissed as she's gonna be when she finds out why I blew her off... I need your help, Max.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't see how you cheating on Natalie involves me.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: I know what you're thinking.  But the truth is, this other person is not someone I'm in love with.  As a matter of fact, after what she just did, she's not even someone I like much.  So in a technical sense, I'm not sure you could call me and her cheating...officially.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Do guys actually believe their lame, self- serving excuses?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Max--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Or do you think we're just so grateful to have one of you idiots we'll look the other way, which is arrogant and condescending.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Lame, self-serving, arrogant...guilty as charged.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You left out condescending.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: But there's another side--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Here it comes.  The part where the guy turns everything around.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: I'm the victim here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Hear me out.  This person I've been seeing is a Jam Pony client who happens to be married--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And you were a sympathetic ear.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Then a sympathetic mouth, then a sympathetic--

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She had me followed the other day and found out about Natalie.  Now, this person's demanding I blow her off or she'll do it for me by telling Nat about us.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Does this person have a name?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Lydia.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And Lydia telling Natalie the truth makes you a victim in what way?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: I'm a toy to her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: A toy?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She's as much as said so.  But she doesn't want to share her toy with anyone else... It's just an ego thing with her.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Fight fire with fire.  Threaten to go to her husband.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Who either doesn't care, or could have me killed.  Either way, Natalie's still gonna find out.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What happens if you level with her?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Even if she doesn't dump me, which is unlikely, she'd never be able to trust me again.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And why should she?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Look Max, I made a terrible mistake.  One I'll never, ever make again.  Natalie and I are soulmates.  I know that now.  She's the woman I want to spend the rest of my life with.  I guess it took the thought of losing her for me to understand that.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: So you're straight on how this is gonna go down.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You set up on Lydia.  When she's on her way over to the apartment you give me the heads up.  I answer the door and pretend to be Natalie.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She tells you how I've been--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: --a philandering pig.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: But you explain that you're a compassionate and understanding person who can find it in your heart to forgive me.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Or, I dissolve into an angry, hysterical wreck who never wants to see your lying ass again, which is probably what would really happen.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: I just don't want Natalie to ever find out.  She deserves better.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How'd you get her out of town?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Convinced her she needed to visit her mom in San Mateo.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And we're sure Lydia's gonna make her move?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She came by the apartment once already. Fortunately, I'd disconnected the doorbell as a precaution... Lydia's not gonna back off until she gets her pound of flesh.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'll give it my best shot.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Max, what did I do to deserve a friend like you?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You don't.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: You rock, Max.  You... Rock...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Easy Sketchy.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: No, I'm serious.  That psycho got exactly what she deserved... Yes.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Lydia may not have been one of humanity's finer specimens but--

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She's toxic...monster in bed, but toxic.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You would be making a mistake to come away from this thinking she's the villain in the piece... You are.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: She was the one--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: None of this would've happened if you had exercised even a smidgen of good judgement or self-restraint, which you didn't.

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: True, but--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You were trying to have it both ways and you were being completely selfish.  And if I ever find out you're going out the back door on Natalie again, you're the one who's gonna be hanging by your ankles three stories up.  Understand?

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: Okay, okay, okay--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Say the words, "I understand."

turns.speaker: SKETCHY
turns.text: That was extreme!  Did you see that one guy--

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Shut-up...

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: This is a hot run.  Beat it.  You're late.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I was on call.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: I want you on call here.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What's the difference if I'm on call here or deployed in the field.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: More like deployed in bed asleep.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't sleep... Theo asked me to pick up his check.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: And Theo can't pick up his own check because?...

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: He's sick.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: For a change.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How 'bout you don't break my sneakers on this.  The guy is seriously not well.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: You tell Theo he's not in tomorrow he can start looking for another job.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know how to break this to you, Normal, we're all looking for another job.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: Fourteen-thirteen Market.  Get a signature, then take it to this address... By the way, that guy who was in here sniffing after you yesterday called twice already.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Tell him I took the day off 'cause I wasn't feeling so hot.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: What about this?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm taking the rest of the day off 'cause I'm not feeling so hot.

turns.speaker: NORMAL
turns.text: Hot run to 842 Beulah, corner of Haight... And you can tell your pal Theo he just got his worthless ass fired. Not that he cares but the wife and kid might.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Theo's dead.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Thanks, miss.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You're too kind. I'm Amanda.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Right, well, thanks for the drinks and stuff, Amanda, but there's no reason for me to stick around these parts anymore.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Don't be so glum, Hawk. The night's still young and filled with plenty of compensatory possibilities.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I'd be in a position to spend some money on you if you'd get in a position and spend some time on me.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Gin.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Whoa. Some of this hard liquor's a tad too manly for me. I'm a brewski man myself.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Better ease up then, Hawk. Wouldn't want to give you whiskey dick would we?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Who's Whiskey Dick?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Well. Obviously no one you have to worry about... Woody.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: My name's not Woody, it's Haw-haw...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Well, Amanda, this has been quite a night. So far you've seen me and my dick throw up.  What's next? Projectile diarrhea?  Man. What a stud, huh?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Believe it or not, you still have a way to go before you start competing with my soon-to-be-ex-husband... the champion of lousy lovemaking. The man who thinks he's the biggest and the best... The man who thinks every secretary, stewardess, and cocktail waitress he fucks should lick his feet for the honor. The man for whom faking it was invented. Christ, if I hadn't gotten pregnant with our son, I would have never known I even had sex with the prick.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: You love him?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I just told you, he's a big, hairy...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: No, I mean... you love your son?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: More than anything in the world.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: And he loves you back, doesn't he?

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: He's a little spoiled, but I know he does.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Well, shame on him if he doesn't.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Amanda, as ironic as this is gonna sound, I can't take any money for... I'm no Midnight Cowboy, y'know. It would only cheapen the whole deal for me.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: I'm not paying you for the lovemaking, Hawk. I just want you to have whatever you needed the money for when you took me up on my offer.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You're a little scrawny, but thanks to the concert we're low on amateurs. Name?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Hawk.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Pick a song, Hawk.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Got any KISS?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You kidding? This is Detroit. Drink?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Yeah, a man's drink...

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You mean you never seen a Jack Daniels on the rocks before?

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Sure, I have. But not one with ice in it, that's all.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Save your money, stud muffin. The lady at the end of the bar sends her love.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Whoa... she is a killer.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Amanda Finch. Her ex is one of the wealthiest businessmen in Detroit. Play your cards right and you could hit paydirt. She like 'em young.  And since you look a little new at this, let me give you three words of advice. Hard to get. Think it, act it, know it, be it. Nothing a woman loves more than when you beat her at her own head games.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: Oh, Dicky, I c-c-can't...

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: You're not gonna chicken out on me now, are you? We've got your KISS song playing and everything.

turns.speaker: HAWK
turns.text: I-I c-can't...

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Look, people undress in public because, A, they're exhibitionists, B, they're nutcases, or C, they need the money. I can tell you're not A, and I hope to hell you're not B. So my suggestion is, think about why you're a C and let your body party, shake your groove thing, boogie oogie oogie till you just can't boogie no more.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Jeremiah?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Beth? I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Believe it.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I didn't mean for that to be so... intense. Forgive me.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I don't care. I wanna hear more.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I've loved you ever since I first laid eyes on you, Jeremiah. I've just always been too scared to show it.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Beth, I can't believe you just said that because that's exactly how I've always felt about you... Call me Jam. It's my band name.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: You don't know how long I've been waiting to hear that... Jam!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: We've got to take this slow...

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Right, slow...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Oh, screw it!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: So. Is it true that Gene Simmons had a cow's tongue grafted onto his real one? Y'know, to make it so long?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: I dunno. I think he had the piece of skin under his tongue removed so he could stick it out farther. I'm not too up on Gene trivia.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Your man is the drummer, Peter Criss, right?

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Peter Criss is my inspiration, man. If I paid a hundred bucks for a KISS show and all I saw was his solo, I'd consider it... money... Hey, how'd you know that?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I have all your notebook doodles memorized, Jam... Here.

turns.speaker: JAM
turns.text: Ann Arbor?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: My dad's company is relocating him. We're moving. That's why I was acting so freaky in school today. I thought it was the last time I'd ever see you. Anyway, open the box. I would have given it to you this morning, except... like I said, I was freaking out.
